events.originalText: An explosion, allegedly caused by a North Korean torpedo, sank the South Korean warship ROKS Cheonan near Baengnyeongdo in the Yellow Sea, killing 46 sailors.
events.subtitle: Torpedo
events.headline: North Korean torpedo sinks South Korean warship ROKS Cheonan, killing 46 sailors

events.originalText: A jury began deliberations in the trial of Jack Kevorkian, an American practitioner of physician-assisted suicide who was charged with murder in the death of a terminally ill patient.
events.subtitle: Jack Kevorkian
events.headline: Jury deliberates in trial of Jack Kevorkian for physician-assisted suicide

events.originalText: Police in Rancho Santa Fe, California, discovered the bodies of 39 members of the religious group Heaven's Gate who had died in an apparent cult suicide.
events.subtitle: Rancho Santa Fe, California
events.headline: Police find 39 bodies in Heaven's Gate cult suicide in Rancho Santa Fe

events.originalText: With the signing of a peace treaty in Washington, D.C., Egypt became the first Arab country officially to recognize Israel.
events.subtitle: Egypt–Israel peace treaty
events.headline: Egypt first Arab country to recognize Israel with peace treaty in Washington, D.C.

events.originalText: The Biological Weapons Convention, the first multilateral disarmament treaty banning the production of an entire category of weapons, entered into force.
events.subtitle: Biological Weapons Convention
events.headline: Biological Weapons Convention banning production of weapons enters into force

events.originalText: Jonas Salk announced the successful test of his polio vaccine on a small group of adults and children.
events.subtitle: Jonas Salk
events.headline: Jonas Salk tests successful polio vaccine on adults and children

events.originalText: Spanish Civil War: Nationalists began their final offensive of the war, at the end of which they controlled almost the entire country.
events.subtitle: Spanish Civil War
events.headline: Nationalists launch final offensive in Spanish Civil War

events.originalText: First World War: Attempting to advance into Palestine, the British were defeated by Ottoman troops at the First Battle of Gaza.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: British defeated by Ottomans in First Battle of Gaza during First World War

events.originalText: First Balkan War: After a five-month siege, Bulgarian and Serbian forces (artillery pictured) captured the Ottoman city of Adrianople.
events.subtitle: First Balkan War
events.headline: Bulgarian and Serbian forces capture Adrianople in First Balkan War

events.originalText: An explosion at the Brunner Mine in New Zealand killed 65 coal miners in the country's deadliest mining accident.
events.subtitle: Brunner Mine disaster
events.headline: Explosion at Brunner Mine in New Zealand kills 65 coal miners

events.originalText: Perceiving that the Canadian government was failing to protect their rights, the Métis people led by Louis Riel began the North-West Rebellion.
events.subtitle: Métis
events.headline: Métis people led by Louis Riel begin North-West Rebellion in Canada

events.originalText: A Dutch military expedition was launched to bombard Banda Aceh, the capital of the Aceh Sultanate in present-day Indonesia, beginning the Aceh War.
events.subtitle: First Aceh Expedition
events.headline: Dutch military expedition bombards Banda Aceh, starting Aceh War

events.originalText: The Boston Gazette printed a cartoon coining the term "gerrymander", named after Governor Elbridge Gerry's approval of legislation that created oddly shaped electoral districts.
events.subtitle: Boston Gazette
events.headline: Boston Gazette coins term 'gerrymander' in cartoon

events.originalText: The Safavid Empire began a four-year occupation of the Ottoman city of Basra on the Persian Gulf.
events.subtitle: Safavid dynasty
events.headline: Safavid Empire occupies Ottoman city of Basra

events.originalText: William Caxton (pictured) printed the first English translation of Aesop's Fables.
events.subtitle: William Caxton
events.headline: William Caxton prints first English translation of Aesop's Fables

events.originalText: Reconquista: The Muslim city of Algeciras surrendered after a 21-month siege and was incorporated into the Kingdom of Castile.
events.subtitle: Reconquista
events.headline: Algeciras surrenders to Kingdom of Castile in Reconquista

events.originalText: Byzantine emperor Maurice proclaimed his son Theodosius as his co-emperor.
events.subtitle: Maurice (emperor)
events.headline: Byzantine emperor Maurice proclaims son Theodosius as co-emperor
